data.title: First and Probably Last Visit
data.text: Thai Curry is a lovely restaurant in Tamarac.  We were courteously greeted, and seated immediately.  Despite a large group ahead of us, our service was initially quick.  I ordered sushi, and when it arrived, I realized I'd forgotten to ask for no seeds.  So I asked to have it wrapped up for home and ordered the same meal without seeds.  The fast service ended there.  In fact, I believe the waitress forgot all about bringing that meal for some time, when actually she should have rushed it.  The sushi was a shrimp tempura and was not at all generous with the shrimp.  Further, the roll was filled with fried tempura batter bits.  In this way the roll was made to look larger, while offering nothing in the way of health or nutrition. It seemed like a way to trick the consumer to me, and I didn't appreciate that. The roll also seemed to be missing the avocado it was supposed to have and had another ingredient it wasn't supposed to have.  You might ask why I didn't complain.  It was because I was so hungry by then I'd have eaten almost anything! My brother enjoyed his meal, but did not consider it to be anything special.  The price was not exorbitant, but it wasn't inexpensive either, and was overcharge considering what we got and the fact that mine was "beefed up" with fried bits of batter. The only thing we really liked about the place was the decor, and that's not enough to bring us back.

data.title: Food is fair, location smell needs some attention
data.text:
We had lunch at Thai Curry. This was our first visit. Upon opening the door, there was no mistake, something smells! There is a smell similar to rotten seafood.  After a while, the smells is not as repulsive.  We noticed that the carpet was extremely dirty. Maybe that was the source of the odor.
The food was fine. Not as salty as expected. I would recommend the shrimp curry.  The price was fair. If the carpet was changed and the smell eradicated, the ambiance would be more appealing.  The dim lighting is fine. I would eat from Thai Curry in future.  Next time, I will order takeout.

data.title: Spiced down for locals but still good!
data.text: We had pad thai and shrimp with ginger sauce, not spicy at all. I think they cater to the elderly population of the area - not like up in MA where most food comes with at least one pepper. But it was pleasant and the before 6 PM meal came with soup (most delicious broth!), veggie eggroll, hot tea, and ice cream.

data.title: something has changed
data.text:
don't know if they have a new chef, but, the food was poorly done.  the tom yum goong
was ok, but, very fishy.  the entree of chicken in chili sauce was so sweet, i felt as if it was chicken awash with cherry jam.
i have been coming here for the past 15 years, and at least two owners.  currently the dining room looks shabby, and not in a good way.  at the doorway is an old fish tank (minus the fish) with filthy cloudy water.  the outside of the vessel is filthy.  the carpet is almost bare.  in addition, the waiter has just a few rotten teeth left in the front of his mouth.  not very appetizing.  time to find a new thai restaurant.

data.title: Amazingly Authentic
data.text:
Cannot rave enough of the food and management.  We have been going here for years and have never had a bad experience.  The food is wonderful and the staff is top notch.  Looking for some great Thai food.......Thai Curry is the place.
Side note:  they have made great accommodations for our vegan friend.

data.title: Good food.. average ambience... great value for money!
data.text:
I work in the vicinity and so I keep coming here for lunch often - I think 6-7 times so far. This is the only decent Thai/ Asian joint nearby on Commercial Blvd. 

Usually the place is empty with a few tables having guests. That means we get personalized service :)

The lunch specials are very good here. Economical and tasty. We have eaten so far all the chicken and shrimp dishes on the lunch menu. The personal favorites are -
Chicken Cashew
Chicken Garlic
Chicken Ginger
Chicken Panang
Shrimp Basil
Shrimp Garlic
Shrimp Green Curry

Avoid the Chilli Chicken - its more like sweet and sour chicken

Oh and do try the Eskimo Shrimp - that is delicious!! And the Sticky mango rice during mango season!

Overall I would rate as - 
Ambience - 3/5 (it is a little dark, dingy and sometimes dirty)
Food taste - 5/5!!  
Presentation - 4/5 
Food quantity - 4/5
Service - 5/5 
Price - 5/5

data.title: Smells Weird
data.text: If smell is a sign of authenticity, this place is the "Real McCoy!"  The food isnt bad if the smell doesnt deter you.  Nice place, but definitly needs some updating.

data.title: Great for take out!
data.text: I have been ordering from this restaurant for the past three years! They are always consistent. The food is excellent and always cooked fresh to order! I wouldn't recommend eating in since it is very dreary!  The prices are reasonable and the customer service is always pleasant.

data.title: Horrible service
data.text: My Husband and I always believe that tips should be 20% but this time we didn't even tip that's how horrible the service at this place was. The fried rice was the worst, the food court at the mall is a five star compare to this. We were extremely hungry and couldn't even eat it. PLEASE DON'T DO THAT TO YOURSELF. HORRIBLE.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: This restaurant is phenomenal and far exceeds expectation first time here both had curry and would highly recommend   Keep up great work

data.title: Very good and something different.
data.text:
Meal was awesome! So many different flavors unexpected blends of foods. We loved it!
Ambiance was perfect for a nice quiet dinner.

data.title: Lovely dinner
data.text: Stopped in for dinner while passing through town.  We found the staff friendly and helpful.  I ordered the sea scallops in curry sauce and my husband ordered the beef and broccoli.  Both meals were delicious.   My husband ordered brown rice instead of the standard old white rice.   I can't eat rice so was offered steamed vegetables instead.  They have a very varied menu and I was surpised to see even a lamb dish on the menu.  I would have gotten that had I not had lamb the night before.

data.title: inconsistent spicing and food temperatures
data.text: thai food, as you are aware, can be ordered in several levels of spicy. my tom yung goong, supposed to be medium, had no spiciness at all.  my squid in garlic sauce, also ordered medium spicy, almost burned through my palate.  vegetables were cool (temperature), squid was perfect. it's good thai food for a local place.

data.title: A Hidden Jewel!
data.text:
I've lived in Tamarac for a couple of months now and have had a couple "run in's" with bad asian cuisine. But Thai Curry has definitely changed my perception of the local asian cuisine! The restaurant was small and quiet, the server was friendly and prompt, and don't even get me started about the food!

Of course we started the meal with some Thai Iced Teas. Then we moved to apps - we split a Beef Satay (perfectly seasoned/cooked beef skewers), an order of Siam Rolls (Crispy rolls of chicken, shrimp, crab meat and clear noodles. Served w/ plum  sauce), and and order of Eskimo Shrimp (Crispy golden wrapped shrimp stuffed with crab meat and minced chicken. Served w/ plum sauce.). Now the Beef Satay is a standard at any Thai restaurant (still the best we've had), but the other two apps a shot in the dark and OH MAN did we hit the target! Next time I'm ordering both of those as my entree. 

As for the main course - we all decided to get Pad Thai. I had squid (odd choice, but I was already in an adventurous mood from the apps and once again HOME RUN!) my fiancé ordered beef and her brother ordered chicken. All three dishes we cooked to perfection.

Finally, well we couldn't skip dessert, so the three of us split TWO orders of Thai Donuts... nothing like some perfectly friend dough dipped in sweetened condensed milk to polish of an epic meal. 

If you are in the area stop by this place and enjoy some of their great food. Oh and I almost forgot to mention that at the end of our meal our server informed us the everything was homemade and MSG-Free... you can't beat that!

data.title: great fried wings and sauce - nice decor
data.text: 1st visit - had the wings - fried with 2 sauces sweet and a hot - combined the 2 - best wings I have had in years, nam sod good more limey than usual but good, my friend did not like the beef broccoli - décor clean and decent - had to keep asking waiter to take our order - always had to prompt him - over all would absolutely go back for the wings and nam sod and would like to try the tom kai gai

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: We went here for dinner at my friend's suggestion. Glad we did!! The decor is very pretty, and I felt under-dressed with shorts and a short.  The service was friendly and the food came very quickly.  The shrimp pad thai had an abundance of seafood. The sweet and sour chicken wasn't fried, but instead had a light and delicate sauce. The chicken was very flavorful.  For dessert we splurged with tempura ice cream which was exquisite!! It looked gorgeous and tasted even better. Although the window had a sign reading, "now serving sushi," the menu did not contain any sushi items. For thai food, you will not be disappointed in the quality, and the price was right!   Of note, they probably do a large take-out business as well.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: I discovered this restaurant years ago and it had been consistently excellent. Freshly prepared food, charming atmosphere and attentive service. I returned within the last month and was disappointed. The service was inefficient, the wait endless and the food was tasteless. The staff seemed quite overwhelmed with only three tables (maybe they were short a waiter?) and we sat and sat waiting for our food. The curry and pad thai are still good, but we tried some different dishes and were completely dissatisfied. The coconut shrimp, for example, had flavor at all. I mentioned this to the server and got zero reaction, so I highly doubt we will return. I recommend a tiny little Thai place on Federal and Cypress Creek (62nd St.) if you have a craving!

data.title: Good Thai
data.text: Not so busy local restaurant in shopping center for years has done a very good job with all type of Thai dishes.  Excellent peanut sauce for it's chicken special dish.  My whole family has enjoyed eating here.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: Friendly service and very accomodating for vegetarians and vegans.  I love the Pad Thai and my husband likes the Massuman Curry.  We can get both with tofu and without fish sauce.  (Also hold the egg on the Pad Thai.)

data.title: AWESOME FOOD!!!!!
data.text:
My husband and I went to this restaurant for dinner. We actually had a livingsocial coupon for this restaurant and we are glad that we went. The food is extremely delicious and great! Ambiance is beautiful.. The food is very authentic and well presented. 

We are definitely going there again!
